article_title: Malaysia Airlines Presses Ahead on Plan for New Jets
article_text:
Malaysia Airlines said Saturday it would press ahead with its fleet-renewal program as part of a long-running plan to turn around the ailing national flag carrier.

Ahmad Jauhari Yahya, chief executive of Malaysia Airlines, said the airline would take delivery of up to eight Boeing 737-800 jets by 2015. The company currently operates 56 of the...

twitter.description: Malaysia Airlines said Saturday it would take delivery of up to eight new Boeing 737 model jets by next year as part of a plan to turn around the ailing carrier.
twitter.creator: @ByJasonNg
